critique: This document primarily concerns the administration and adjustment of pay schedules for federal employees. It delegates authority to the Office of Personnel Management (OPM) and other agencies to manage pay adjustments, locality-based comparability payments, special pay authority, and other related matters. There is nothing about immigration, civil liberties, or diversity. It does revoke a previous executive order and terminates the Executive Assignment System. It does not seem to have a strong ideological leaning, nor does it obviously expand executive power. It seems to be more about the efficient management of federal employee compensation.
